How can I debounce rapid table state changes?
React Table has a few built-in side-effects of it's own (most of which are meant for resetting parts of the state when
data

changes). By default, these state side-effects are on and when their conditions are met, they immediately fire off actions that will manipulate the table state. Sometimes, this may result in multiple rapid rerenders (usually just 2, or one more than normal), and could cause any side-effects you have watching the table state to also fire multiple times in-a-row. To alleviate this edge-case, React Table exports a
useAsyncDebounce
function that will allow you to debounce rapid side-effects and only use the latest one.
